signals.Ask: We need a seamless transition from Zendesk to Hubspot for our support model.
signals.Evidence: We are most likely going from Zendesk to Hubspot at some point later this year.

signals.Ask: We need integration with Microsoft Teams to generate tasks from Teams messages.
signals.Evidence: Could hiver draw from teams messages to generate tasks like it does from email?

signals.Ask: We need a system that can push and pull information to and from Shopify to track order statuses and notes.
signals.Evidence: Yeah, we need actually push pull and pull, push you. Want to push an order to Shopify. We need to push the status of this order or even nodes back to Shopify?

signals.Ask: We need the ability to set custom statuses for emails beyond the standard options.
signals.Evidence: And can they set other statuses? Can we custom that Cole? So, no, these are standard statuses.

signals.Ask: We expect the AI to provide accurate and relevant responses based on the uploaded training material.
signals.Evidence: Docspot gave us the correct information based on the same material that I uploaded into hiver. But hiver gave us this information on the right, which… was incorrect. Basically all of it was incorrect.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to separate email and chat correspondence in our shared inbox to improve organization and efficiency.
signals.Evidence: It's such a silly thing, but it doesn't separate those in an inbox. So if you're in a shared inbox, all emails and chats are just kind of like lumped into one communication funnel, which makes it next to impossible to organize yourself as an employee.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to integrate with more document management systems like ClickUp, Confluence, and Google Drive.
signals.Evidence: We're working on ClickUp, Confluence, and Google Drive as the immediate items for the rest of this quarter.

signals.Ask: We need a system that can handle categorization beyond Gmail's label limit to improve searchability and organization.
signals.Evidence: About a year ago or more, we exceeded our maximum. I think it's like 50,000 like labels. Yeah. So basically any client who's come to us in the last year is unlabeled. It's impossible to search.

signals.Ask: I need to understand how Hiver stores and organizes messages per client.
signals.Evidence: My question is how does Hiver store the messages that's my, that's the big thing I cannot, you know, determine how they store the messages, how we would organize it per client, that type of thing?

signals.Ask: We expect not to be charged the full year during the trial period.
signals.Evidence: The trial period was supposed to end today. It's just, we got charged the full amount without, you know?

signals.Ask: We want to have a bit more visibility on who's working on what, and have a better auto assignment as well.
signals.Evidence: And instead, we just decided to look at options that are more fit for business purpose, and also improve a bit on reporting because that's something a bit of a pain point at the moment.

transcripts.title: Hiver Trial Check in <> Solar Guys Pro

signals.Ask: I want to be able to tag and assign teams without having to open the email.
signals.Evidence: I also thought that if there was a way that I could tag and assign teams without actually opening the email, like if I could do it on the outside of the email, but I don't think that's possible.

signals.Ask: We need something with AI that can take the task to answer customer emails automatically without human intervention.
signals.Evidence: We don't have the resources and we need something with AI that can take the task to answer them.

signals.Ask: We need to have full visibility of emails before they are closed.
signals.Evidence: I've got going to closed. I've got to view them that way and I'm not seeing the whole visibility so it could be closed before I've even seen the email.

signals.Ask: We need a solution to automate the management of accounts payables emails to reduce manual effort and errors.
signals.Evidence: The question is where we are trying to find a solution, where my payables are managed in a weekly basis. I would say I process around 100 or 200 invoices. So, yep. And everything is outside the system as we speak today.

signals.Ask: We need a solution that ensures seamless internal communication between the office and warehouse to prevent message loss.
signals.Evidence: Our main problem is communication between the office and the warehouse, so that we don't miss any messages… without look or odoo. The problem persists.

signals.Ask: We need a tool that can automatically draft email responses based on our internal knowledge base and customer interactions.
signals.Evidence: I just want to create a system where we can respond very quickly to the emails... it can automatically write draft an email kind of thing.

signals.Ask: I want every single person on my team to continue to work within their workflows, which is Gmail, and to be able to assign threads to themselves or to different people so that we can ensure that customers get their questions answered very quickly.
signals.Evidence: What happened two days ago is customer sends us a note myself and the CEO both see that note, both immediately start typing a response and we send pretty much the identical response at the same time to this customer.

signals.Ask: Ensure that follow-up emails are sent at the correct intervals as intended.
signals.Evidence: What happened was that both the auto replies went at the same time, which was not our intention.

transcripts.title: Asset Plan | Hiver - Elite upgrade next steps

signals.Ask: We would prefer a month-to-month contract, but we understand your internal processes. We expect a discount if we agree to an annual contract with monthly payments.
signals.Evidence: Yeah, we're open to that. Actually, we would prefer a monthly month to month contract, but we understand that you guys have your way of working internally and want to have your customers side to our contracts.

signals.Ask: We expect a faster response rate from customer support, ideally within minutes.
signals.Evidence: First and foremost is the customer support response rate like whenever we have an issue, it usually takes at least 48 hours for someone to reply even for the first time.

signals.Ask: We need integration with Meta for handling Instagram DMs and Facebook messages.
signals.Evidence: And the only other concerns of integration would be meta because we do have socials and Gmail.

transcripts.title: Hiver Demo Park Street Companies<> Cole

signals.Ask: We need the ability to have multiple knowledge bases for different account bases.
signals.Evidence: We have different knowledge bases. I mean, we have two specific like account bases. One is our supplier account base... And then we do have another side of the business which is essentially the retail aspect... For us right now, we're functioning with both knowledge bases externally… but I understand that you guys offer the one.

signals.Ask: Ensure that form submissions come in a format that our AI can read and process effectively.
signals.Evidence: The major piece with zapier is to make sure that the form submissions come in a format that we can read, that our AI can read and make sure it's sort of playing well and conducive.

signals.Ask: We need flexibility to avoid long-term commitments due to ongoing changes within our organization.
signals.Evidence: Full transparency. I don't think we're going to be looking for a two year contract. Nothing against hiver. We love the tool. We use it. Just a lot of changes going on within AGM, and I don't feel comfortable making the two year commitment at this point.

signals.Ask: Ensure shared drafts are visible in the shared drafts folder.
signals.Evidence: Shared drafts are not showing up in my shared drafts folder.

signals.Ask: We need a shared inbox solution that is HIPAA compliant for internal communication and with stakeholders like payers.
signals.Evidence: We just want to have multiple accounts, be able to share the same sort of like threads with a HIPAA compliant solution going forward.

signals.Ask: Ensure that when a client responds, the email goes back to the same representative to avoid chaos in the inbox.
signals.Evidence: I'd love to see that… not happen. So, you know, like when somebody communicates that it comes back to them specifically, it just sometimes gets a little chaotic in the inbox just so looking for better ways to manage that.

signals.Ask: I want emails marked as read in the shared inbox when they are handled by any team member.
signals.Evidence: I noticed that they were still not marked as read or solved inside the shared inbox with Hiver.

signals.Ask: I was hoping to find something where it could auto assign emails to Jess or to Alex or whoever.
signals.Evidence: I was hoping to find something where it could, you know, auto assign that to Jess or to Alex or whoever.

signals.Ask: We need the contact module to automatically assign an account rep to each account.
signals.Evidence: If the contact module had everything, they don't even need custom objects, but the contact module, not being able to assign an account rep that's the issue.

signals.Ask: We need AI tools to fully automate L1 interactions and empower the L2 team to resolve more conversations.
signals.Evidence: You're looking for a platform to help fully automate L1 interactions, empower the L2 team to, you know, resolve more conversations.

signals.Ask: We need a seamless process for migrating our ticket history from Zendesk to Hiver, including all relevant data like notes and attachments.
signals.Evidence: When we go to migrate from Zendesk to Hiver, the previous ticket history. Is that something that you guys are gonna download for us? Or is that something that we need to download?

signals.Ask: Ensure that the information provided by Hiver AI is always accurate and consistent with the knowledge base.
signals.Evidence: The goal is just to make sure that the information it provides is accurate. So, because generally the idea that Jordan wanted is that in the event that we have new people coming, they can't question the information that hiver AI provides because it will always be correct.

signals.Ask: We need to connect our alias inboxes without creating separate Gmail accounts.
signals.Evidence: The problem with inboxes... we were not able to connect them because we need to create separate Gmail or G suite accounts for those inboxes.

signals.Ask: We need the option to change the admin panel language to English for better understanding.
signals.Evidence: Because admin panel is all in Chinese. And if I can change the language to English, no, then our HQ team will not understand.

signals.Ask: We need a report that shows the aging of emails in the inbox to identify neglected messages.
signals.Evidence: It might be useful to be able to see… kind of the aging, how old the emails are in the inbox.

signals.Ask: We want to automate responses for specific requests like cancellations to improve efficiency.
signals.Evidence: In terms of the like the… AI templates and stuff, are you able to automate certain responses? So… like if someone wants to cancel their booking or the class that they're in, like automate a response, that would then go and say, you know, we'd really appreciate your feedback as to why here's a form to fill in.

signals.Ask: We need a solution to prevent duplicate responses and ensure accountability when using a shared email address.
signals.Evidence: We might having samples and two persons replying the same message, duplicating the message.

signals.Ask: We want the ability to link Jira updates directly to emails, so any updates in Jira can be used to formulate an email response.
signals.Evidence: I'm assuming that this probably doesn't exist, but one thing that I had sort of thought of which would be good would be like, you said that you've got the integration with Jira to create the tickets in Jira from the email?

signals.Ask: We expect AI features like chat and copilot to be included without additional charges.
signals.Evidence: Hiver doesn't charge per usage of the AI. For now. It's all included model and, you know, people like intercom, they're charging per the usage, which is very expensive.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to integrate with our ERP system to track when an RFQ becomes a quote and measure the time between these events.
signals.Evidence: I need to now know that this has gone from an ingested RFQ to a quoted RFQ, right? And I need to know that when that trigger happens, so I can record the time between the two.

signals.Ask: We need AI agents to auto reply to inquiries, reducing manual effort.
signals.Evidence: I think you need AI agents to auto reply to these people.

signals.Ask: We need integration with Confluence for our documentation and knowledge base needs.
signals.Evidence: I see that you guys work with Jira but not confluence. Do you know if that's planning to be added in the future maybe?

signals.Ask: We need seamless integration with our existing CRM system to ensure smooth data flow.
signals.Evidence: Our current CRM system is central to our operations, and any new tool must integrate seamlessly with it.

signals.Ask: We need the user interface to be available in French to accommodate our Quebec-based customers.
signals.Evidence: Yeah, I'd say in Quebec, a lot of customers like it to be in French that's usually let's say one of the blockers.

signals.Ask: We need to ensure that no emails are missed from the joint inbox as it's critical for our operations.
signals.Evidence: Any chance of missing any emails from that joint inbox because it's critical that we don't miss anything?

signals.Ask: We need integration between the client portal and QuickBooks to show clients a copy of an invoice that was paid.
signals.Evidence: I wonder too with the integrations into other systems, you know, quickbooks is one that we use regularly as well. Is there any sort of integration with the patient portal and quickbooks as well?

signals.Ask: We need assurance that all custom fields and historical data from Zendesk will be accurately represented in Hiver during migration.
signals.Evidence: This information is actually really critical. Can we get this or not? I don't know if we could just do a small subset of the information and do that in our test environment or?

signals.Ask: We need a way to collaborate with other teams without the end user seeing the internal collaboration.
signals.Evidence: We basically need a way to collaborate with other teams like that without the actual end user with the problem, seeing the internal collaboration between our teams.

signals.Ask: We need a way to create a trial account without being blocked by existing account associations.
signals.Evidence: Your email, when we try to create a trial or sign you up, right? You're already associated with an account. So we need to get you removed from this account, so we can start a trial account.

signals.Ask: I need to know what features are locked behind the growth or any tier.
signals.Evidence: What are the limitations in the free version? Like what of what we're doing right now, is… locked behind the growth or any tier?

signals.Ask: We need a smoother approval process for app installation to avoid delays.
signals.Evidence: She just said she found it. So, I guess she's approving it now.

signals.Ask: We need the AI to draft email responses based on domain-specific FAQs.
signals.Evidence: What we're trying to figure out is how to actually, I guess have the system draft an email response based on this based on the domain.

signals.Ask: We need a system to reduce email clutter and ensure that only relevant emails are in our main inboxes.
signals.Evidence: I want them to be able to kind of like parse and see what's what, right? So, it's 10 45. I've got like 13 emails here involving one random truck shipment, but I've also got like a really hot ocean freight email that I need to address, but I don't know, I need to address it yet because I'm going through so many truck shipment emails.

signals.Ask: I want one inbox and I want to see everything in one inbox.
signals.Evidence: Now I want one inbox and I want to see everything in one inbox. So let's say if I'm in the office today and my colleague is not, I want to pick it up.

transcripts.title: Hiver Trial Check in <> Solar Guys Pro

signals.Ask: We need an automated tagging system that can categorize emails based on keywords to streamline our workflow.
signals.Evidence: Currently, no one takes control of this mailbox. All that anyone does is when they're working, it's like we just search the order number and they look at all the emails linked to that order number.

signals.Ask: We expect the AI tasks to manage our workflows end to end, including extracting order numbers and drafting emails with order status.
signals.Evidence: To summarize it, it was basically when an email comes in regarding asking information on the lines that, hey, what is the status of my order? The AI agent would pick up that email, pick up the order number from that email, look into your ERP system, pick up the status of what the order number, or rather what the status of that specific order number is, and then draft out an email saying that, hey, this is the like drafted an email for your end user saying that, hey, this is your order number. This is what the status of the order is, and let it be in the draft section for your end user to only see it, review it. If it's good, send it out that's the workflow you're looking to build.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to share attachments through public permalinks.
signals.Evidence: While right now, hiver does not support the ability to share attachments through public permalinks and for security purposes, but I get an understanding as to why this would be valuable for your team.

signals.Ask: We thought that this was an onboarding session now. So this is what we thought. We just want to start using it and we needed some help.
signals.Evidence: Yeah. Well, we thought that this was an onboarding session now. So this is what we thought. We just want to start using it and we needed some help.

signals.Ask: We expect the email summarization feature to support multiple languages, not just English.
signals.Evidence: May I ask this is now in English? Is it in English? Because English is the only available language?

signals.Ask: We need a clear process for setting up shared inboxes using either Google or Outlook credentials without causing confusion.
signals.Evidence: No. So, guys here's, the thing, right? So, if we are going to go with Google, then everybody has to use their Google credentials and Google groups or shared mailbox from Google accounts. It's not going to be like half in Google and half in outlook, that's not going to work?

signals.Ask: The tool should be easy to use and not complicated.
signals.Evidence: I installed the tried version on my computer, but it's like, yeah, complicated for me.

signals.Ask: Ensure that responses to outbound emails are automatically assigned back to the original sender.
signals.Evidence: I need hiver to know the user that sent that email and reassign that response back to that same user.

signals.Ask: We need a platform that integrates seamlessly with our existing sophisticated build-out.
signals.Evidence: So, unfortunately, we actually built out cause we have a dev team. So we built out quite a sophisticated build out with Zendesk and we're pretty happy with that.

signals.Ask: We expect the integration to be seamless and not clunky, as the other option we're evaluating has this feature natively.
signals.Evidence: I think the only concern would be that because this isn't native, it might be clunky to start, but that's the only thing I can think of off the top of my head.

signals.Ask: We need the AI to determine urgency and priority of emails through context, not just keywords.
signals.Evidence: Can it determine urgency… and priority is what Fabio is asking? Can it bubble up urgent things?

signals.Ask: We expect a pricing model that aligns with our actual usage to avoid overpaying for unused licenses.
signals.Evidence: Yeah, it sounds like we'd just be overpaying.

signals.Ask: We need a system where emails can be automatically routed to the correct person to improve response times.
signals.Evidence: We're really looking for hopefully for a system where we can have some sort of automation where it would be able to go to the direct person almost like a ticketing.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to send emails from specific domains for our AR team.
signals.Evidence: We do not have flexibility on the Ar team like it has to come from those addresses. So it's a pretty table stakes to consider it of.

signals.Ask: We need a solution to manage a shared inbox where multiple people can work without causing chaos by responding to the same emails.
signals.Evidence: We have one person solely on it, but if anybody tries to help, then it becomes mass chaos because it's one box and several people working within the same stuff.

transcripts.title: Hiver AI Usage Dashboard || Secure Choice Lending

signals.Ask: We need a way to manage sentiment analysis without overwhelming the team with too much negative feedback.
signals.Evidence: It was a little discouraging for the team. So, we would have like so many emails and they were all neutral and like several sad faces. And then we'd get one green one. So the team was just like kind of feeling a little defeated.

signals.Ask: I would love for everything to connect to each other, ideally work out of one place, whether it be Slack or the help desk tool, and they all kind of bi-directionally integrate well.
signals.Evidence: Ideally, I want everyone to like work out of one place, whether it be slack or the help desk tool and they all kind of bi-directionally integrate well.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to share drafts within the team to ensure oversight and communication consistency.
signals.Evidence: Nobody can draft anything. So, if Maria drafts an email to follow up with a client or something like that, nobody can see it.

signals.Ask: Ensure that actions taken in Hiver reflect in Outlook to avoid manual updates.
signals.Evidence: So, no matter what you do in hiver, it will not directly make the changes in outlook, correct?

signals.Ask: We need emails to be automatically drafted in Gmail without manual intervention.
signals.Evidence: Our main focus… is drafting emails automatically in the Gmail because I'm actually not the owner of the account. I'm the assistant of the agent that is going to use that. So he wants to like before he can even open the account. There's already a drafted email automatically for him.

signals.Ask: Ensure shared inbox emails do not appear in personal inboxes.
signals.Evidence: We want to keep this personal inbox completely separate from hiver.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to remove AI-added tags that are no longer needed.
signals.Evidence: Neither one of us could get it to go how we normally would remove or delete a tag.

signals.Ask: I want to talk to someone about the API to pull out some metrics.
signals.Evidence: One thing I'm probably going to need some help with not immediately, but within the next week or so is just having someone I can talk to about the API.

signals.Ask: We need a tool that allows us to keep emails in our Gmail inbox while organizing them effectively.
signals.Evidence: Our emails are getting forwarded to the helpdesk, and we don't have those in our inboxes those emails.

signals.Ask: We need an email management tool with a dashboard to monitor email volume, team performance, and KPIs.
signals.Evidence: We do not have any dashboard where we can see all the email process KPIs. So we are looking for the email management tool where we can get all the insights and all the monitoring part.

signals.Ask: We need a feature that alerts us if an email has been pending for a given period of time.
signals.Evidence: I think that the feature for the SLAs that you mentioned was going to be really helpful because, you know, just for this pain point that I just mentioned, you would already solve it by alerting us if an email has not, has been pending for a given, you know, period of time.

signals.Ask: We need to know the format and timing for providing our customer list to ensure proper setup.
signals.Evidence: So… when we last spoke at the last meeting, you mentioned that you would need a list of our customers or something to be able to set things up fully. Can you talk a little bit about that? And, when do you need that? Is there a particular format?

signals.Ask: We need a more secure way to manage account access, especially with seasonal staff.
signals.Evidence: We have all the accounts and everybody has the password from each account, and that also, it's not so secure because we also have a staff for the season that they only work for three months.

signals.Ask: We need a way to automatically filter out emails that do not require action.
signals.Evidence: We also get a lot of automated emails from our own system. So they need to be ideally filtered out. You know, they don't really require attention.

signals.Ask: We want the AI to automate the whole thing by itself without needing to manually insert drafts into emails.
signals.Evidence: We don't want that we want the AI to automate the whole thing by itself.

signals.Ask: I want a self-running Gmail automated service that doesn't require supervision and can automatically read and respond to emails.
signals.Evidence: I'm looking for a self centered running Gmail automated service so that it doesn't require any of supervision. So it should be like running on its own.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to have more than five starred views to accommodate all our schools.
signals.Evidence: So one of the first ones that the team and I kind of noticed was just around the starred views. Is there a way for us to have more than five?

signals.Ask: We need a system that can understand the context of emails and forward them to the appropriate team member automatically.
signals.Evidence: We needed something more capable to understand the context of the email and create the forwarding based on what's actually written in the email.

signals.Ask: We need a customer support solution to centralize inquiries from multiple email accounts and social media.
signals.Evidence: We are lacking in terms of the organization is some kind of like customer support solution where inquiries are coming in via different channels such as multiple email accounts… as well as social media.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to use Hiver with our existing email setup, which includes both Outlook and Gmail accounts.
signals.Evidence: So on hiver, you either have to be on outlook or Gmail, right? Currently, you are like, it's a mix like your individual emails are on outlook and your shared email is on Gmail. And that too with a different domain. So, and with this setup, hiver will not be able to suffice as it will not work with hybrid because hybrid needs, either you are on Google workspace completely or you are on Microsoft completely.

signals.Ask: We need customized views for each user to manage emails effectively.
signals.Evidence: We use Google system, but that collaborative inbox is not working too well, and we're also testing out the dedicated user access, but that only gives like one single signature and there's no customized view for each user.
